abstract: Shanghai’s World Expo is expected to be a tourist bonanza, drawing 70 million people between May and October. But with China’s leaders aiming to turn the city into a globally competitive financial capital by 2020, it is also a golden opportunity to start recruiting bankers and barristers to settle down on the banks of the Huangpu River.
snippet: Shanghai’s World Expo is expected to be a tourist bonanza, drawing 70 million people between May and October. But with China’s leaders aiming to turn the city into a globally competitive financial capital by 2020, it is also a golden opportunity t...
lead_paragraph: Shanghai’s World Expo is expected to be a tourist bonanza, drawing 70 million people between May and October. But with China’s leaders aiming to turn the city into a globally competitive financial capital by 2020, it is also a golden opportunity to start recruiting bankers and barristers to settle down on the banks of the Huangpu River, Julie Makinen reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Shanghai Opens Doors to Financial World

abstract: China Merchants Bank, the country’s sixth-largest, will launch a $3.2 billion rights issue this week to bolster its balance sheet after a lending binge last year, sending its shares up 3 percent, Reuters reported.
snippet: China Merchants Bank, the country’s sixth-largest, will launch a $3.2 billion rights issue this week to bolster its balance sheet after a lending binge last year, sending its shares up 3 percent, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: China Merchants Bank, the country’s sixth-largest, will start a $3.2 billion rights issue this week to bolster its balance sheet after a lending binge last year, sending its shares up 3 percent, Reuters reported.

headline.main: China Merchants Issuing $3.2 Billion in Shares
